docs.snippet: Volume of business transacted was fairly heavy in the foreign exchange market during the past week. British pound sterling and most Western European currencies were weak against the U.S. dollar. On the other hand the Canadian dollar showed a very...
docs.lead_paragraph: Volume of business transacted was fairly heavy in the foreign exchange market during the past week. British pound sterling and most Western European currencies were weak against the U.S. dollar. On the other hand the Canadian dollar showed a very strong undertone as it moved higher.

headline.main: Foreign Exchange Rates; Week Ended Feb. 24, 1961

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., March 3 -- Following are items approved for inclusion on the agenda of the resumed session of the fifteenth session of the United Nations General Assembly, which will convene here Tuesday, and proposed additional items...
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., March 3 -- Following are items approved for inclusion on the agenda of the resumed session of the fifteenth session of the United Nations General Assembly, which will convene here Tuesday, and proposed additional items (explanatory material within parentheses was compiled by the United Nations Office of Public Information):
docs.abstract: Kazakhstan Agr Min Roginets ousted, replaced by K Arystanbekov

headline.main: Items on Agenda for Second Part of U.N. General Assembly Session

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., March 3 -- Act Two of the Fifteenth General Assembly opens here next Tuesday without the dramatic cast that dominated the fall performance but with the same major theme -- the Congo.
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., March 3 -- Act Two of the Fifteenth General Assembly opens here next Tuesday without the dramatic cast that dominated the fall performance but with the same major theme -- the Congo.

headline.main: FAMILIAR ISSUES UP AGAIN IN U.N.; The 15th General Assembly, Resuming Tuesday, Will Face Congo Problem

byline.original: By JAMES FERON Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: A firmer undertone than was evident in previous sessions prevailed in the foreign exchange market during the past week. British pound sterling and Canadian dollar, after early weakness, finished strong on active dealings.
docs.lead_paragraph: A firmer undertone than was evident in previous sessions prevailed in the foreign exchange market during the past week. British pound sterling and Canadian dollar, after early weakness, finished strong on active dealings.

headline.main: Foreign Exchange Rates; Week Ended March 3, 1961

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, March 9 -- President Kennedy named Dr. Harold Brown today to be director of research and engineering for the Department of Defense.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, March 9 -- President Kennedy named Dr. Harold Brown today to be director of research and engineering for the Department of Defense.

headline.main: PHYSICIST TO HEAD RESEARCH IN ARMS; Dr. Harold Brown Chosen for Pentagon Post -- Dean Named for Atom Talks

docs.snippet: ACAPULCO, Mexico, March 10 (AP) -- The Inter-American Press Association's scholarship fund awarded six scholarships worth $2,500 each today to journalists and journalism students in the United States and Latin America.
docs.lead_paragraph: ACAPULCO, Mexico, March 10 (AP) -- The Inter-American Press Association's scholarship fund awarded six scholarships worth $2,500 each today to journalists and journalism students in the United States and Latin America.
docs.abstract: IAPA-NY Times scholarship donated by Sulzberger presented to J L McVey

headline.main: PRESS UNIT GIVES SIX SCHOLARSHIPS; $2,500 Grants Awarded -- Two to Go in U.S. and Four in Latin America

docs.snippet: The foreign exchange market was in a complete state of confusion during the past week. Rumors of revaluation and devaluation were circulated freely. The U.S. dollar in terms of other currencies was under constant pressure and lost ground. British...
docs.lead_paragraph: The foreign exchange market was in a complete state of confusion during the past week. Rumors of revaluation and devaluation were circulated freely. The U.S. dollar in terms of other currencies was under constant pressure and lost ground. British pound sterling, weak in the early part of the week, rallied sharply on the announcement by Selwyn Lloyd, Chancellor of the Exchequer, that Great Britain had no intentions of devaluing the pound.

headline.main: Foreign Exchange Rates; Week Ended March 10, 1961

docs.snippet: Nine major musical organizations, nearly a dozen major soloists and more than two dozen composers will be represented at the second Inter-American Music Festival in Washington from April 22 to April 30.
docs.lead_paragraph: Nine major musical organizations, nearly a dozen major soloists and more than two dozen composers will be represented at the second Inter-American Music Festival in Washington from April 22 to April 30.

headline.main: PAN-AMERICAN UNION TO HOLD MUSIC FETE
